<!-- autogenerated don't modify -->

# @paprika/input - 0.2.21

## Description

Input component

## Installation

```
yarn add @paprika/input
```

or with npm:

```
npm install @paprika/input
```

## Props

### Input

| Prop           | Type                | required | default           | Description |
| -------------- | ------------------- | -------- | ----------------- | ----------- |
| a11yText       | string              | false    | null              |             |
| className      | string              | false    | null              |             |
| defaultValue   | string              | false    | null              |             |
| hasClearButton | bool                | false    | false             |             |
| hasError       | bool                | false    | false             |             |
| icon           | node                | false    | null              |             |
| inputRef       | union               | false    | () => {}          |             |
| isDisabled     | bool                | false    | false             |             |
| isReadOnly     | bool                | false    | false             |             |
| onChange       | func                | true     | -                 |             |
| onClear        | func                | false    | () => {}          |             |
| size           | ShirtSizes.DEFAULT  | false    | ShirtSizes.MEDIUM |             |
| type           | InputValidTypes.ALL | false    | "text"            |             |
| value          | string              | false    | ""                |             |

## Usage

<!-- autogenerated don't modify -->
<!-- content -->
### Usage

The Input can be used as a controlled or an un-controlled component.

To use it as controlled:

```js
import Input from "@paprika/input";
...
const [val, setVal] = React.useState("Hello world");
return (
  <Input
    value={val}
    onChange={e => {
      setVal(e.target.value);
    }}
  />;
);
```

To use it as an un-controlled component:

```js
import Input from "@paprika/input";
...
return (
  <Input
    defaultValue="Hello world"
    onChange={e => {
      console.log(`The new value is ${e.target.value}`);
    }}
  />
);
```
